synopsis.text:
Nao and Miki, two eighth-grade best friends, form the Digital Camera Club at their school, with Nao serving as the club's manager. Nao's fascination lies in capturing images of the sky and clouds. One day, she encounters a peculiar cat capable of controlling the wind on the rooftop, her favorite spot for photography. Startled, Nao falls off the roof, leading to a series of events that unravel the secrets of wind manipulation.

Their math teacher, Taiki, is a master of wind control and belongs to the ancient Kazetsukai clan. He saves Nao's life and introduces her, Miki, and their classmates Ryouko and Jun to the hidden world of wind manipulation. As the group learns to harness their newfound powers, they embark on a journey to Taiki's home village to celebrate the annual Wind Festival and uncover the mysteries surrounding wind control.

Along the way, they encounter a diverse cast of characters, including Ryoko, who harbors feelings for Taiki, and Yukio, the widow of Taiki's deceased brother. In this village on the outskirts of the city, the Wind Festival begins, and Nao and her friends dive deeper into the enigmatic world of wind manipulation, filled with flying cats, lost tree squirrels, and photography contests.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
